trial_identification.studytitle: Physical activity for adults with serious mental illness.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Second generation antipsychotic weight gain and the facilitators and barriers to physical activity for adults with serious mental illness: a qualitative study.

interventions.interventions: The barriers and enablers of physical activity for adults with serious mental illness and effects of medications on lifestyles will be elicited through qualitative interviews or focus groups. Interviews and focus groups are antipated to last for up to one hour.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The primary outcome in this study are participants views pertaining to barriers and enablers of physical activity, and effects of medications on lifestyles. The data on these outcomes will be assessed with thematic analysis.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Data analysis of the primary outcome will be conducted through April and May 2012, approximately two to three months after the completion of data collection.

othercollaborator.othercollaboratoraddress: 84 Yorketown Road Elizabeth Park 5113 South Australia

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This qualitative study will investigate the effects of second generation antipsychotics on weight gain, and the enblers and barriers to physical activity for adults with serious mental illness.
